intro: Ononis viscosa var. pitardii, commonly known as the pitardii sandwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically linear and covered in fine hairs, adapting to arid and rocky environments. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained conditions.
